Instrument.name: Gas Instrument for ULY
Instrument.description: The Ulysses Gas instrument will measure the properties of local interstellar gas, specifically neutral helium, for the first time. It uses the solar gravitational field to analyze the bulk velocity and temperature of the gas based on particle angular distributions from two heliosphere locations. Assuming a cosmic abundance composition, gas density can also be determined. Detection of neutral particles occurs via secondary electrons or ions from impacts on a lithium-fluoride layer. The instrument's principles, technical features, and initial measurements in space are summarized.
